channel.title: Mumbai News, Latest Mumbai News, Mumbai News Today and Headlines | Hindustan Times
channel.description: Mumbai News - Find latest Mumbai news and Headlines based from Mumbai City. Also check out latest news belongs to Mumbai crime, Mumbai education news, Mumbai real estate, Mumbai politics and more at Hindustan Times.
channel.copyright: Copyright (C) 2019 HT Media Limited. All Rights Reserved.

image.title: Mumbai News, Latest Mumbai News, Mumbai News Today and Headlines | Hindustan Times

item.title: More car-centric than pedestrian-friendly: Activists object to raised dividers on roads
item.description: An official from the BMC said that space for crossing is given for pedestrians at fixed distances, which differs from road to road, and is for the safety of the pedestrians.

item.title: BMC school student points out error in science text book
item.description: Gaurav Shukla received a congratulatory email from Balbharati for pointing out the error and informed him that the mistake will be corrected in the textbook’s next edition. On Friday, his school and the civic body felicitated Shukla in its Currey Road office

item.title: Anti-incumbency, infighting, OPS issue cost BJP two seats
item.description: Of the five seats from the teachers and graduate constituencies, the party wrested the Konkan teachers’ constituency from the Peasants and Workers Party (PWP) but lost the Nagpur teachers and Amravati graduate constituencies.

item.title: Another text in HC cited to prove validity of changed nass
item.description: Mumbai: On the 28th day of the final hearing of the Syedna succession case in the Bombay high court, defendant Syedna Mufaddal Saifuddin’s counsel on Friday cited a book titled ‘Al-Sulaimaniyyah’ to reiterate that nass could be changed

item.title: One year on, water hyacinth invades Ulhas river again
item.description: Kalyan: The water hyacinth (killer weeds) that was cleared from the surface of Ulhas river, a year ago, has returned

item.title: Mumbai train network with funds from budget
item.description: Mumbai: With elections coming up, Mumbai has been showered with mega funds to improve its suburban rail system

item.title: Both suspects arrested in Chunabhatti college student murder case
item.description: Mumbai: Two people, who were absconding, were arrested on Friday for allegedly stabbing a 19-year-old college student to death in Sindhi Colony, Chunabhatti, on Thursday evening

item.title: How Indian textiles, from Kashmir to Kanyakumari, travelled the world and back
item.description: There are 13th-century block prints from Gujarat, 17th-century embroidered bedspreads from Bengal, 18th-century kalamkari costumes from the Coromandel Coast (the south-eastern side of India’s coastline), and 19th-century striped pashminas from Kashmir

item.title: Air purifier towers would be waste of money, says Thackeray
item.description: Thackeray also wrote a letter to civic chief I S Chahal suggesting that the budget should be limited to covering establishment cost and funding for the ongoing projects. No new projects should be announced in the absence of an elected body, he insisted in the letter

item.title: After council poll rout, Shinde-Fadnavis may have to take a call on OPS
item.description: The ruling alliance’s disastrous performance in the council polls - losing three out of five seats - may force the Eknath Shinde-Devendra Fadnavis duo to do a serious rethink on bringing back the old pension scheme (OPS)

item.title: Bizman arrested for circulating fake coins minted by Haryana gang
item.description: The Delhi police officials said that during their investigation, they found that a man in Mumbai had been taking huge quantities of fake coins to sell the same to shopkeepers and priests in temples and other religious places where coins are in demand and devotees ask for a change to donate and other ceremonies

item.title: On budget eve, Chahal seeks counsel from a former commissioner
item.description: Chahal dialled up nonagenarian D M Sukhtankar for his advice on how to present a budget when an administrator is ruling the civic body.

item.title: Eight civic officials to face the music on illegal film studios
item.description: Mumbai: At least eight civic officials, at the level of junior engineers, who failed to take action against five film studios in the Madh-Marve region for functioning beyond their licence period, will be liable for punishment, stated a 5000-page confidential report

item.title: India’s first dedicated transgender ward opens at GT Hospital
item.description: For years, doctors have experienced the community being uncomfortable in getting admitted to a male ward. And we saw resistance from female patients. Therefore, the need for a separate ward for trans persons was always felt. Because of the space crunch at JJ Hospital and St George being reserved for Covid, we decided to start the dedicated ward at GT Hospital

item.title: CBI court grants bail to Anil Deshmukh’s PA
item.description: The order, which came a day after the special PMLA (Prevention of Money Laundering Act) court granted him bail, paves the way for Shinde’s release from jail.

item.title: 41 deadly accident spots identified on Mumbai-Goa highway
item.description: Navi Mumbai: Fifteen days after 10 members of a family were killed in a head-on collision with a truck on Mumbai-Goa Highway, the police have identified 41 potential accident spots and found several loopholes on the highway, such as missing signages for road diversions

item.title: Malavika’s Mumbaistan: Dancing In The Dark
item.description: As anyone will tell you, lavani performances are marked by their robust ribaldry and their naughty take on a range of issues, from matters of the heart to the socio-political issues of the day. Typically, lavani is performed on a public stage, to the vigorous beats of a Dholki and the lyrics are sexually- explicit

item.title: Hours after electoral victory, MVA partners begin bickering
item.description: The squabbling began with NCP leader Ajit Pawar sympathising with rebel Congressman Satyajeet Tambe—who has been expelled for six years for contesting the recent council elections as an independent—and advising the Congress to re-admit him into the party fold.

item.title: Postponement of PG exams: State warns MU of disciplinary actions
item.description: A letter sent to the universities by the principal secretary of higher and technical education stated that it is a serious matter that MU and Shivaji University have postponed examinations even as discussions are underway between non-teaching staff of state universities and the state government.

item.title: Vadhavan Port documentary film: Cops summon organisers of public screening
item.description: The film examines the anticipated impact of the Vadhavan Port project on indigenous communities in Palghar’s Dahanu taluka

item.title: Man booked for duping woman, relatives of ₹67 lakh
item.description: The accused – a Borivali (West) resident – told the complainant and her relatives that he had good knowledge of share trading and can help them earn a good profit if they invested money in shares as per his plans.

item.title: 53-year-old gets 17-year jail for raping minor daughter
item.description: On December 19, 2016, the accused again went to the house of the complainant and she was bleeding. When the complainant asked her to go back to her house, she refused and narrated the entire ordeal to her.

item.title: Bio-medical waste incinerator at Govandi adheres to emissions norms, says MPCB
item.description: The quality of emissions from BMC’s bio-medical waste incinerator at Govandi has improved substantially since September 2022 when an upgraded air pollution control system was installed, Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) has said

item.title: 60-year-old blackmailed with intimate photos; ₹4 lakh siphoned
item.description: On Wednesday morning, the complainant received a message from a woman who wanted to conduct an intimate video call with him.

item.title: Sanjay Raut sends legal notice to Narayan Rane
item.description: Mumbai: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader and Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Raut has accused the union minister for small and medium enterprises, Narayan Rane, of defaming him and has issued him a legal notice asking him to tender an apology or face legal action

item.title: Rustom Baug in Byculla celebrates centenary year
item.description: Built by Bai Jerbai Wadia in memory of her late son, the residential colony, continues to be a ‘self-contained’ thriving community centre for 330 families

item.title: Security beefed up in Mumbai after NIA gets a terror threat on email
item.description: After receiving the e-mail, NIA on Thursday afternoon alerted Mumbai police, Maharashtra police and state Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS)

item.title: Mumbai's Gowardhan raises cow milk price by ₹2 per litre, 2nd hike in a month
item.description: Gowardhan Milk Prices: With this, the Gowardhan Gold variant will now cost ₹56 per litre as compared to ₹54 earlier marking the brand's second rate hike in a month.

item.title: MVA likely to win 3 out of 5 council seats; BJP manages to bag 1
item.description: The MVA candidate was declared elected in the Nagpur graduates’ constituency and appeared to be winning in the Aurangabad teachers’ constituency and Amravati graduates’ constituency. The BJP won only one seat — the Konkan teachers’ constituency while the Nashik graduates’ constituency went to Tambe, who won the polls by a margin of 29,465 votes against MVA candidate Shubhangi Patil. Tambe secured 68,999 votes

item.title: Mulund to get muddy water for over a month, thanks to BMC’s laxity
item.description: The water to Mumbai and suburbs comes from the Bhandup water treatment plant (WTP), which runs through a water tunnel underground passing through Thane. An illegal borewell dug in Thane has damaged the tunnel, stated the civic body’s note

item.title: Pathaan’s very own ‘Bharat Jodo’ moment
item.description: You may love the film or hate it but you cannot ignore the box office collection for Shah Rukh Khan-starrer Pathaan which stood at ₹332 crore for India on Wednesday, as per trade website Box Office India

item.title: 3 key Mumbai projects under scanner after Adani stumbles
item.description: The ₹23,000 crore Dharavi Redevelopment Project, the ₹16,700 crore Navi Mumbai International Airport and the power distribution license for Navi Mumbai all under renewed scrutiny following market rout

item.title: Sheena Bora murder case: CCTV footage of Guwahati airport submitted to court
item.description: The Guwahati airport authority on Thursday submitted to the special CBI court the CCTV footage of January 5 when Indrani Mukerjea claimed that a woman looking similar to her deceased daughter Sheena Bora was spotted by two lawyers

item.title: Set up air purifier towers, CM tells Chahal
item.description: The country’s first smog tower was inaugurated in Connaught Place, New Delhi, in August 2021, followed by a second one in Anand Vihar, in September of the same year. At the time the devices were touted as a solution for the Capital’s mounting problem of air pollution

item.title: ₹100 crore recovered from builders after MahaRERA nudge
item.description: Mumbai: Over ₹100

item.title: Sewri resident tries to extort ₹1 crore from developer; booked
item.description: Mumbai: An extortion case was registered against a Sewri resident for allegedly trying to extort ₹1 crore from Rubberwala Developers by threatening to defame him on social media

item.title: University exams postponed all over state
item.description: Mumbai: Owing to the decision of the non-teaching staff of state universities and colleges to boycott the examinations, some post-graduate and undergraduate exams of Mumbai University (MU) have been suspended from February 3 onwards

item.title: Maha board cracks down on cheating in exams
item.description: In a first, the Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education (MSBSHSE) has given schools the go-ahead for a mandatory session with students taking board exams to let them know the repercussions of cheating

item.title: Chahal to present BMC budget on February 4
item.description: On Saturday Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal will, for the first time in 38 years, present the budget in the absence of corporators

item.title: Matheran toy train to get AC saloon coaches
item.description: This comes at a time when Matheran continues to be one of the favourite tourist destinations for Mumbaiites. On this narrow-gauge line of CR, passenger figures in 2022 have surpassed 3 lakh with the total revenue from April to December 2022 generated by running the toy train standing over ₹2.2 crore

item.title: College student murdered by two in Chunabhatti
item.description: Preliminary inquiry has revealed that the fight between the deceased youth and the accused was over a love affair with a girl

item.title: ATS files chargesheet against 5 PFI office-bearers
item.description: Mumbai: The Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) on Thursday filed a chargesheet against five office-bearers of the Popular Front of India (PFI), who were arrested following nationwide raids for allegedly being involved in unlawful activities and waging war against the nation

item.title: No HC relief for Sheezan in Tunisha suicide case
item.description: Pai submitted that the police had recovered the CCTV footage, which showed that Sharma was normal prior to Khan entering the room, but after he exited, she seemed very disturbed. The bench was assured that the investigation was going on in a proper manner

item.title: 12 years on, trial in triple blasts case begins at MCOCA court
item.description: Trial in the 2011 triple blasts case began before a special MCOCA (Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act) court on Thursday

item.title: Ward for dogs with special needs where strays were once killed
item.description: Run by an NGO, In Defense of Animals (IDA), the neutering centre in Bainganwadi is currently home to 25 blind dogs, 15 paralysed dogs, 10 blind cats and seven paralysed cats

item.title: Owner of fake call centre arrested for luring people into fraud investments
item.description: Mumbai: A 28-year-old man was arrested for allegedly running a fraud call centre in Goregaon West luring Indians and American citizens into investing in foreign exchange, currency and commodity trading

item.title: SFIO case: HC permits Shraddha Binani to travel to London till February 20
item.description: Last year, the HC rejected her petition seeking the quashing of three summons issued to her by SFIO as part of their investigation into the allegation by the resolution professional of ₹2,400 crore of fraud by the company against which insolvency proceedings were initiated in 2017

item.title: MMRDA to prepare blueprint for $250 billion economy
item.description: Mumbai: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) has decided to prepare a blueprint for making the region a $250 billion economy in the next five years

item.title: March 31 deadline for colleges to start NAAC process
item.description: Mumbai: The state higher education department has issued a circular that colleges without the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC) rating should start the accreditation process by March 31 or face action

item.title: Kharghar couple crowdfunds to save baby, medicine costs ₹17.5 cr
item.description: A Kharghar couple, who recently found out that their 15-month-old son is positive for Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA), are racing against time to raise ₹17.5 crore for a one-time drug that needs to be administered before the child turns two

item.title: Maha Council polls: BJP wins Konkan, loses in Fadnavis home turf Nagpur
item.description: Maharashtra Council polls: Sudhakar Adbale, supported by the MVA, won the Nagpur teachers constituency defeating his closest rival Nagorao Ganar, a BJP-backed independent and the sitting MLC from the seat.
